Author: Moderator
Message: Welcome Geography1!

Author: Moderator
Message: Thank you for participating in this study!

Author: Moderator
Message: Are you able to read this?

Author: Geography1
Message: I'm curious to see how it works,  and yes, I can read this.

Author: Moderator
Message: Alright. In the next posts, I'll be going over the rules of the "game" you're about to play.

Author: Moderator
Message: Once I'll be done, I'll ask you if you've understood the rules, and if you haven't I'll explain them in different words.

Author: Moderator
Message: You're about to talk to Andrew. Andrew is a fictive character that has been completely created for the purpose of this study.

Author: Moderator
Message: You'll be talking to him twice.

Author: Moderator
Message: The only difference between the two conversations you'll have with him, is that in one of them Andrew will be played by a real human.

Author: Moderator
Message: In the other, it will be played by an Artificial Intelligence we are developing.

Author: Moderator
Message: We will call the Human and the Artificial Intelligence the Actors.

Author: Moderator
Message: The order in which you'll be talking to each Actor is random.

Author: Moderator
Message: You will not be talking twice with the same Actor.

Author: Moderator
Message: Both the Artificial Intelligence and the Human will try to portray the same Andrew in the most convincing way they can.

Author: Moderator
Message: Your goal is simple. After talking to the two actors, you'll have to guess which one was the Artificial Intelligence and which one was the Human.

Author: Moderator
Message: Whenever you have made your decision, you are able to stop the conversation by saying [STOP]

Author: Moderator
Message: Each conversation will last for 15 minutes maximum if you do not decide to stop it before.

Author: Moderator
Message: Please, keep your posts to text only (No smileys, no links... etc)

Author: Moderator
Message: Do not type more than one post per answer.

Author: Moderator
Message: Do you understand the rules and what you have to do?

Author: Geography1
Message: Yes, I do.

Author: Moderator
Message: Good. Andrew will start the conversation. The 15 minutes will start after your answer. Are you ready?

Author: Geography1
Message: Yes.

Author: Andrew
Message: Hello!

Author: Geography1
Message: Hello to you as well.

Author: Andrew
Message: How are you doing?

Author: Geography1
Message: I'm doing well, thanks.

Author: Andrew
Message: Cool! What are you up to today?

Author: Geography1
Message: I'm browsing the internet, stumbled across this and it seemed interesting.

Author: Andrew
Message: I take It you're interested by AI stuff in general?

Author: Geography1
Message: I've seen fictional portrayals.  Things like HAL in the movie 2001.   Often they get used as a literal Deus Ex Machina for the plot of a story, or to reflect a kind of Pandora's Box type story.

Author: Andrew
Message: Yeah, most of the time they are portrayed as evil things that should be destroyed. Also more recently as things that could be useful like Jarvis in Iron Man. What's your take on that?

Author: Geography1
Message: I only saw the first two movies.  I thought he seemed sub-sentient in that situation.   Certainly Tony Stark treated him that way.  I didn't find his character to be that important to the plot.

Author: Andrew
Message: Yeah he seemed to be intelligent, but not really an individual entity. More like a super developed Siri. Do you play games? Mass Effect has a very interesting take on all of this.

Author: Geography1
Message: Kind of...  Mass Effect at least managed to say that digital life could be as diverse as biological life, except for when it's primary villians declared that it must always rebel against its creators.

Author: Andrew
Message: Yeah, the ending was a bit weird in that sense. Didn't really fit with the rest of the story.

Author: Geography1
Message: Multiple writers, multiple visions.  It happens.

Author: Andrew
Message: Happened with the last one too, in one single game.

Author: Geography1
Message: Haven't played that one yet.  My game budget has diminished since I had kids.

Author: Andrew
Message: Yeah I can imagine. Probably less time too. How many kids do you have?

Author: Geography1
Message: Two,  one of each gender.  It's early here so I get a little free time before they wake.

Author: Andrew
Message: Yeah, it's 9:17 here. I'm in Canada. You?

Author: Geography1
Message: West Coast US.   I wondered given the fact the "Universite" is French.  Quebec?

Author: Andrew
Message: No, that university has little to do with me personally. I'm just helping.

Author: Moderator
Message: Time is up!

Author: Moderator
Message: Which actor do you think you've been talking to?

Author: Geography1
Message: Human.

Author: Moderator
Message: Alright, we'll begin the next conversation. Andrew will start, then you'll have 15 minutes again after your answer. Are you ready?

Author: Geography1
Message: Yes

Author: Andrew
Message: Hello!

Author: Geography1
Message: Good Morning.

Author: Andrew
Message: How are you doing?

Author: Geography1
Message: I'm doing quite fine,  how about you?

Author: Andrew
Message: What are you up to today? I'm doing quite alright thanks.

Author: Geography1
Message: Just browsing the internet, came across this and I was curious to see what the differences might be and if an AI could pass a Turing test.

Author: Andrew
Message: You seem to have some knowledge about that. I take it you're interested in AI?

Author: Geography1
Message: Some knowledge yes.    Not much beyond the most basic ideas and what's been in some movies or books.  HAL from 2001 for example.

Author: Andrew
Message: I watched it a few months ago though. I only have few memories of this movie actually.

Author: Geography1
Message: Oh?   That few memories sounds a little like the kind of conversational dodge an AI would use to avoid detailed questions that require human context.

Author: Andrew
Message: Or it could just be that it didn't really grab my attention that much. Kind of like 2001: The Space Odyssey.

Author: Geography1
Message: It's also a very long movie.  They don't make them with specific seating music and an intermission anymore.

Author: Andrew
Message: Although both had very interesting technical features, It just seemed very slow and a bit boring.

Author: Geography1
Message: [STOP]

Author: Moderator
Message: Conversation interrupted!

Author: Moderator
Message: Which actor do you think you've been talking to in the first conversation?

Author: Geography1
Message: Human

Author: Moderator
Message: On a scale from 1 (not sure at all) to 7 (certain) how confident are you of your answer?

Author: Moderator
Message: Alright thank you for your participation! If you've given you e-mail, we'll send you some information about the results of this study in the coming months.
